org.magelan.core.renderer
Interface Decorator

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDecorator, ColorDecorator
public interface Decorator

Decorator s are similar in concept to DrawingRenderer s with the difference that only set the styling (color, paint, stroke, font, etc.) of drawing elemetns. Decorators cannot be queried about the geometry of the elements. Decorators are not stand-alone; they must be managed by a CompoundRenderer.

Version:
1.0, 02/2005
Author:
Assen Antov
See Also:
CompoundRenderer

Method Detail

configure

void configure(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
               java.lang.Object element,
               DrawingModel model)
Configures the parameter graphics context with the proper color, stroke, paint and alpha for the element.

Parameters:
g - graphics context to configure
element - the element to configure the context for
model - the drawing model to get rendering information from (layers, colors, etc.)

isSupported

boolean isSupported(java.lang.Object element)
Determines whether the parameter element is supported and can be decorated.

Parameters:
element - element to lookup
Returns:
true, if should decorate
